Name: PublishDatePrompt
Comment: No apostrophes (') allowed in this message

Name: PropertiesPanel
Comment: This is an accessibility name and should be localized.

Name: PropertiesPageOrder
Comment: For specifying the order in which Pages appear on WordPress. The value will be an integer

Name: PropertiesPageParent
Comment: For specifying the parent Page of a Page for WordPress.

Name: PropertiesSlug
Comment: A slug describes a post or page in a few words. Used by WordPress to form a permalink URL for the post. See this link for details: http://codex.wordpress.org/Glossary#Slug

Name: PropertiesPings
Comment: This refers to sending an HTTP request to notify servers that a blog has been updated. For more info

Name: PropertiesTags
Comment: This replaces Keywords for (currently) WordPress blogs only

Name: PropertiesCommaSeparated
Comment: Used inside the Trackback URLs control in the post property dialog

Name: PropertiesDefault
Comment: Default option for author, comment policy, etc.

Name: PropertiesCommentPolicyNone
Comment: Comments are not allowed on the post

Name: PropertiesCommentPolicyOpen
Comment: Comments are allowed on the post

Name: PropertiesCommentPolicyClosed
Comment: No new comments are allowed on the post

Name: PropertiesShowHide
Comment: This is an accessibility name and should be localized.

Name: CategoryControlCategories
Comment: {0} - comma-delimited list of categories

Name: CategoryControlCategory
Comment: {0} - the single category that is selected

Name: DynamicCommandMenuMore
Comment: If all the options can't be shown in one menu then this is the last option in a menu and it launches a form that shows all the options

Name: AlignMenuItem
Comment: From the context menu when right-clicking on text in the editor.

Name: PluginInsertSidebarText
Comment: {0} will be the name provided by the plug-in.

Name: PluginInsertSidebarTooltip
Value: Insert a {0} into the current document
Comment: {0} will be the name provided by the plug-in (e.g. Video

Name: TruncatedString
Comment: {0} - a string that is being truncated

Name: WithEllipses
Comment: {0} - a command name that needs to be followed with ellipses, in accordance with Windows UI guidelines

Name: ConfigWizardLearnMore
Comment: {0} - Open Live Writer

Name: ConfigWizardChooseWeblogType
Comment: The header for the screen for choosing blog type (Spaces, SharePoint, or Other).

Name: ConfigWizardBasicInfo
Comment: The header for the screen that prompts for homepage and login.

Name: CWBasicText
Value: To use {0} you must already have an account with a blog service. If you do not already have an account with an existing blog service, create one now.
Comment: {0} - Writer

Name: CWBasicTitle
Comment: {0} - Writer, {1} - "your blog" or name of blog service

Name: CWBasicTitleDefaultService
Comment: See CWBasicTitle

Name: CWBasicHomepage2
Value: This is the web address that visitors use to read your blog.

Name: CWBasicCreateAccount
Value: If you do not already have a {0} account create one now. Click the link below to open the web page that will begin your online registration.
Comment: {0} - Microsoft Account

Name: CWSelectBlogText
Value: More than one blog was detected. Please select the blog that you'd like to add from the list below:

Name: CWSelectImageEndpointText
Value: Please select the collection that you'd like images to be uploaded to:

Comment: The hex value of the single character that will be used to represent each character in a password field.

Name: CWLiveIDCreateAccount
Value: If you use Hotmail, Messenger, or Xbox LIVE, you have a Microsoft Account ID.

Name: CWSpacesUsernameExample
Comment: Example of Microsoft Account ID

Name: CWLiveIDCreateAccount2
Value: Don't have a Microsoft Account ID?

Name: CWSharePointText
Value: To use {0} you must have a SharePoint blog.
Comment: {0} - Open Live Writer

Name: CWSharePointTitle
Comment: {0} - Writer

Name: CWSharePointText2
Value: Enter the login required to publish to your SharePoint blog.

Name: CWSharePointUseSystemLogin
Value: Use my &Windows user name and password

Name: CWGoogleBloggerDescription
Value: To configure Google Blogger please sign in.

Name: CWTitle
Comment: Caption of the Add Blog Wizard window.

Name: ProgressSaving
Comment: {0} - a filename

Name: ProgressDownloading
Comment: {0} - a URL

Name: ProgressPreparingListOfFiles
Value: Preparing list of files to download...

Name: ProgressDeterminingType
Comment: {0} - a URL

Name: ProgressAnalyzingHomepage
Value: Analyzing blog homepage web address and contents...

Name: CWConfirmText
Value: Please confirm that you would like to save this blog.

Name: CWConfirmText2
Value: Writer will periodically check for, and download, new configuration information for your blog.

Name: CWConfirmThanks
Value: Your blog has been set up

Name: CWWelcomeCaption
Value: Welcome to the world of blogging!

Name: CWWelcomeAlreadyHave
Value: I &already have a blog set up

Name: CWWelcomeText
Value: Use {0} to blog about whatever interests you. Add photos and videos, and then publish to popular blogging services, including WordPress, Blogger, and TypePad.
Comment: {0} - Open Live Writer

Name: AboutAbout
Comment: {0} - Open Live Writer Beta

Name: AboutVersion
Comment: {0} - version number, e.g. 2.0.1

Name: AboutConfigurationVersion
Comment: Displays the version of Writer's configuration file in the about dialog

Name: ProductDisplayVersion
Comment: {0}- the build number like 12.00.1234.1234.

Name: ProductNameVersioned
Comment: Versioned product name for about dialog.

Name: LinkAdvanced
Comment: {0} - double chevron pointing left or right, depending on whether the advanced properties are showing or not

Name: BytesFormat
Comment: {0} - a number (integer)

Name: KilobytesFormat
Comment: {0} - a number (with or without decimals)

Name: MegabytesFormat
Comment: {0} - a number (with or without decimals)

Name: GigabytesFormat
Comment: {0} - a number (with or without decimals)

Name: ImgSBLocalImage
Comment: {0} - a file size (e.g. localized equivalents of "10.2MB", "108 bytes", etc.)

Name: ImgSBLocalImage2
Comment: {0}, {1} - file size (e.g. localized equivalents of "10.2MB", "108 bytes", etc.). The {0} value will be for the inline image, the {1} value will be for the "View Larger" image.

Name: RecentPosts
Comment: Category description for recent posts that appears in Writer's taskbar jumplist.

Name: RecentDrafts
Comment: Category description for recent drafts that appears in Writer's taskbar jumplist.

Name: ShowXPosts
Comment: {0} - a number

Name: LinkToSource
Comment: Navigate to the source picture when the selected image is clicked.

Name: LinkToSourceLabelTitle
Comment: Shows the user that the selected image links to the original image

Name: LinkToSourceDescription
Value: Navigate to the source picture when the selected image is clicked.

Name: LinkToURL
Comment: Choose the location to go to when the selected image is clicked.

Name: LinkToURLLabelTitle
Comment: Shows the user that the selected image links to a URL

Name: LinkToURLDescription
Value: Choose the location to go to when the selected image is clicked.

Name: LinkToNone
Comment: Make the selected image not be a link.

Name: LinkToNoneLabelTitle
Comment: Shows the user that the selected image is not a link

Name: LinkToNoneDescription
Value: Make the image not be a link.

Name: InsertImageSize
Comment: The size, in pixels, of the selected image

Name: DimensionsFormat
Comment: {0} - width, {1} - height

Name: ImgSBLinkOptionsDisabledTooltip
Value: This command is disabled for web images and some image types.

Name: DecoratorNoRecolorLabel
Comment: Remove any black and white or sepia applied on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorNoRecolorDescription
Value: Remove recolor effects applied on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorBWLabel
Comment: Apply a black and white filter on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorSepiaLabel
Comment: Apply a sepia filter on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorCoolestTemperatureLabel
Comment: Dark blue temperature effect available to apply to the selected image.

Name: DecoratorCoolTemperatureLabel
Comment: Blue temperature effect available to apply to the selected image.

Name: DecoratorWarmTemperatureLabel
Comment: Yellow temperature effect available to apply to the selected image.

Name: DecoratorWarmestTemperatureLabel
Comment: Orange temperature effect available to apply to the selected image.

Name: DecoratorTemperatureDescription
Value: Change the warmth of the colors in the selected image.

Name: DecoratorSaturationLabel
Comment: Make the colors in the selected image vivid.

Name: DecoratorSaturationDescription
Value: Make the colors in the selected image vivid.

Name: DecoratorSharpenLabel
Comment: Apply a sharpening filter on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorSharpenDescription
Value: Apply a sharpening filter on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorNoSharpenLabel
Comment: Remove the sharpening filter on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorNoSharpenDescription
Value: Remove the sharpening filter on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorGaussianBlurLabel
Comment: Apply a Gaussian blur filter on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorGaussianBlurDescription
Value: Apply a Gaussian blur filter on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorNoBlurLabel
Comment: Remove the blur filter on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorNoBlurDescription
Value: Remove the blur filter on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorEmbossLabel
Comment: Apply an emboss effect on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorEmbossDescription
Value: Apply an emboss effect on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorNoEmbossLabel
Comment: Remove the emboss effect on the selected image.

Name: DecoratorNoEmbossDescription
Value: Remove the emboss effect on the selected image.

Name: ColorTempWarmer
Comment: This is displayed on the Color Temperature adjustment control (available by adding the Color Temperature effect from the image sidebar Effects tab) where you can specify whether to make an image warmer or cooler.

Name: ColorTempCooler
Comment: This is displayed on the Color Temperature adjustment control (available by adding the Color Temperature effect from the image sidebar Effects tab) where you can specify whether to make an image warmer or cooler.

Name: InsertImageButton
Comment: This is required since the image dialog has a mnemonic for 'i' which can't be changed.
